intro: Eryngium goyazense, commonly known as the Goiás thistle, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny, blue-green foliage and purple to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique appearance makes it a notable species in botanical studies and horticulture. Eryngium goyazense is also valued for its ornamental qualities and potential ecological benefits.
